intro: Mariscus biglumis, commonly known as the two-seed mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, pale pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the fruit is a capsule containing two seeds. Mariscus biglumis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
